question_text: Select two reasons why a technician might replace a built-in laptop pointing device with an external one.
answer_options: The built-in trackpad causes phantom touches
An external mouse uses less power
The built-in pointing device is unresponsive
The external device eliminates the need for keyboard input
correct_answer: The built-in trackpad causes phantom touches
The built-in pointing device is unresponsive
explanation: Trackpad malfunctions like phantom touches or complete failure often lead users to plug in external USB mice or touchpads.
